intro: Pollardia michuacana, commonly known as the Michuacan pollardia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Mexico. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or limestone-rich habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
